alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clarendon; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 7:32PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Calhoun, Clarendon and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orangeburg, Brookdale, Bowman, Elloree, Orangeburg County Airport, South Carolina State University, Claflin College, Edisto Gardens, Santee State Park, Santee, Cameron, Rowesville, Cordova, Cope, Yonder Field, Wilkinson Heights, Prince of Orange Mall, Edisto, Stumphole Landing and Poplar Creek Landing. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 93 and 105. Interstate 26 between mile markers 147 and 163. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
